result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A Garske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald A Garske is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald A Garske was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $343 paid by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample prev provided per DCSO.

supervisions.notes: Concur to 14CF2153.  To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald A Garske

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
